thread.title: White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted
thread.title_full: White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted

title: White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted
text:
White House visitors go camera crazy after 40-year ban is lifted Caption White House allows picture-taking during tours Susan Walsh, Associated Press 
People take photos of first dog Bo while touring the White House July 1, after officials ended a long-standing ban on tourists taking photos or using social media during public tours of the building. 
People take photos of first dog Bo while touring the White House July 1, after officials ended a long-standing ban on tourists taking photos or using social media during public tours of the building. (Susan Walsh, Associated Press) Caption White House allows picture-taking during tours Chip Somodevilla, Getty Images 
Visitors use their smart phones make pictures of the Red Room during the first day that photography is allowed during White House tours. 
Visitors use their smart phones make pictures of the Red Room during the first day that photography is allowed during White House tours. (Chip Somodevilla, Getty Images) 
After the White House on Wednesday ended a long-standing, 40-year ban on tourists taking photos or using social media during public tours of the building, visitors went a little camera crazy. Loading
